page.title: 01Southern Langdale Forest
page.content: The area is nearly all moorlnd in North York Moors National Park that has been planted with conifers so mostly covered by Langdale forest. The block is relatively flat but overlooked by Cross Cliff Brow to the south which is the north extreme of Dalby Forest. The southern part has a few forms along crosscliff Beek valley devoted mainly to grazing sheep and to the west of these some moorland has been maintained. The area has one small road in the south serving the few farms so access to tourists is very restricted although the scenery make it a popular area, especially to walkers. Blakey Topping, a nearby viewpoint can be reached on foot from this block.
